pullRequest.title: Empty gradle project
pullRequest.bodyText: This new project will add manual instrumentation tools for spring

commit.message:
first draft of readme with initial details
changed author from corporate email to personal

nodes.bodyText:
I'd suggest supporting Java 8+, unless there's a specific reason to only support Java 11+

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            sourceCompatibility = '11'
          
          
            
            sourceCompatibility = '8'

0.5.0 is the latest version, I'd suggest using
apply from: "$rootDir/gradle/java.gradle"

at the top of the gradle file, and then you can use
compile deps.opentelemetryApi
compile deps.opentelemetrySdk
instead of making this a root project, let's add this new module to the existing root project

I'm sure things will get sorted out as the code gets in but one thought is that most dependencies should be compileOnly since spring boot starters actually enable features in a user's app. Instead, the general design should be recognizing when a user app is using a feature and instrumenting only those. @ConditionalOnClass tends to be very important for it :)
I guess this project will be similar to sleuth (maybe it could use it too? not sure). So will be a good reference point I think https://github.com/spring-cloud/spring-cloud-sleuth/tree/master/spring-cloud-sleuth-core

@trask Is this the right package? The other instrumentation in instrumentation-core doesn't use the word contrib. If this is something separate from "official instrumentation", then we may need a contrib folder as well to group them together. But I guess this could just be instrumentation?

I think you get this now from "java.gradle" also

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            	compileOnly 'org.projectlombok:lombok'
          
          
            
            	annotationProcessor 'org.projectlombok:lombok'
is this for lombok? maybe u don't need this anymore also with "java.gradle" above
